description: Had a slice of pepperoni here which was pretty solid, no frills kind of pizza. Plenty of cheese and crust to fill up on a quick meal. Far from outstanding, this place will do the trick if you don't want fancy pizza and just was a quick meal.
author: Zachary T.

description:
I always order here. It's my kids fav and you can't beat the price. It's my son's birthday, I'm at work, and birthday boy wanted pizza. I hurriedly ordered pizza and it was delivered before estimated time. 

I get a phone call from husband so upset. I forgot to leave a tip when I ordered online. Seriously my bad. What was horrible was the delivery driver literally stood in my doorway waiting for his tip and even asked "are you going to tip me?" My husband had no cash and had to borrow from my sons piggy bank. 

I get that tipping is huge, but what if this particular time I couldn't afford to tip?? Or I had forgot to add it like I did I don't like the feeling I'm left with knowing that this delivery driver was so demanding of a tip that he stood in my doorway waiting. Makes the delivery driver seem greedy. Def will be taking a break from Mr. Pizza Man.
author: Sara O.

description:
One time I ordered pizza from this place and it came with no cheese. How do you make a pizza with no cheese? We had to bust out the fork and knife to tackle that disaster. Who wants to eat a pizza like that? Not very many people. 

You'd figure Mr. Pizza Man would know how to make a pizza lmao
author: Marissa J.

description: I would pick no stars if I could. I ordered pizza for a jobsite on a Saturday. It took 90 minutes when i was told it would take an hour. I then had to pay 25 guys overtime pay so I could extend the hours. Pizza cost $225. Labor cost over $7500. NEVER AGAIN!! HORRIBLE!!
author: Justin O.

description: DISGUSTING OVER PRICED FOOD AND RUDE SERIVCE!!!! I ordered a "fettuccine chicken" from a teenager cashier who had no manners what so ever. When I ordered she couldn't look me in the eyes she was too busy texting on her phone. Once I got home to my shock and surprise for $18.99 I got noodles and "RAW UNCOOKED CHICKEN" without any sauce.Stay away from this location if you care about your health. Chicken should be fully cooked and not be Pink.
author: Rudy M.

description: Yes the pizza here is greasy, but it's so tasty, and I so appreciate having Mr. Pizza Man for late night food in an area that's mostly quiet after 9pm.
author: Ziyan C.

description:
Yo ! Really ...like really really ? 
Crust so thin it couldn't hold the toppings. As you see in the picture its way to oily ...the taste was like a frozen  bad pizza. I'm not happy with this pizza ...refund please . I should have went to BRAVOS!
author: T A.

description:
I've been eating their pizza since I was a teen.. Nothing against them when I say this, but their food is DELICIOUS when you're drunk hahaha through my younger tee/young adult days, I've had my share of Mr pizza man sober and drunk.. either way they are good good and good!! 

The pizza dough is light and fluffy, just enough salt to flavor it. The cheese is cheese, melts in the oven, stringy and yummy! The toppings were perfect, not too much and not too little! 

The wings can be better but not bad enough to drop a star, after all the star of the place is the cheesy pizza goodness! The service was great, arrived promptly! 

Everyone has their preference, this one is mine.
author: Jose P.

description:
So this place is pretty ok. The interior of the restaurant definitely leaves something to be desired but I was picking up so that didn't really make that much difference. I had the small cheese pizza and it was adequate, like it wasn't awful but it didn't have that wow factor that east coast pizza has. I ordered through Yelp and that was easy and when I went to pick it up everything was all boxed up and ready to go. The cashier lady was very friendly and it was a good pickup experience.  I think if this place did single slices it would be more popular. I work at SF General and it would be a super close place to get lunch but even the small pizza is giant. 

Overall, it was a reasonably good experience but I don't think I would get this pizza again, it was pretty bland. I would return to try the pastas or the sandwiches and just to go back into the restaurant because it was a friendly place.
author: Amanda G.

description: The chicken parmesan is a must have item after the club if you're tired of Mexican food. Trust me. The portions are huge, they put the perfect ratio of marinara sauce to cheese, and they give you a very considerate amount of vegetables. The owners aren't the friendliest but they more than make up for it with their delicious sandwich.
author: Andrew C.

description: This is an update! Mr. Pizza Man I think I'm liking what I'm tasting now. I wanna guess and say, maybe a new pizza maker? The pizza has been on point the last two deliveries. Not greasy, and just the right amount of ingredients. Keep it up.
author: J M.

description: My little cousin lives on Mr.Pizza Man. Didn't believe the hype until I tried it on fluke. It's now one of my top two pizza choices. The quality of the pizza is not only great, but I was pleasantly surprised that the salad was fresh and crisp. I've also had the buffalo wings and pasta which were also really good. Overall a good choice.
author: Jay W.

description: Wow!! A pizza this is so tasteless. How can you mess up pizza?? We ordered late night, delivery was quick.
author: Ramie S.

description:
Not what it used to be...
For one.
If you buy by the slice get ready to dish out nearly 4$ for a slice .back then you would get a hefty sized slice but if you order two single slices, they'll give you an equivalent of one of them hefty sized slices and split it in two.
Definitely disappointed at my neighborhood pizza spot.Looks like I'll go back to Seranos pizzeria until they step their game up.
Ps.  How is plain cheese pizza the same price as pep?explain
author: Sal G.

description: Clean up your act Pizza Loserman. The surrounding neighbors are fed up with the litter, loitering, and illegal parking associated with your shady business, inconsiderate drivers and degenerate customers.
author: JayBee L.

description: My favorite pizza place but today they disappointed me. Pizza man you forgot the damn cheese on the other half and over cooked it pay attention to your orders.
author: S C.

description: Pizza was cold, delivery took one hour and 20 minutes. Will probably order again just to see if it gets to us faster and if it's good.
author: Estela R.

description: I placed an order for delivery at 220am, tried to follow up with the delivery via phone call to confirm proper address at 232am where I was prompted through a recording that this establishment was closed. I woke up at 305am to doorbell ringing and then the delivery man cussing me out that I didn't put "A"behind my apartment number when I clearly listed and also called to confirm the proper delivery address. I would never order here again unless it's so late that I don't have another choice. The food isn't great either.
author: Rachael H.

description:
Terrible, horrible, worst delivery experience I've ever had. 

We have a bunch of little kids over who were getting hungry. I was told that the food would be 45-60 minutes.

Kids getting grumpy. Called at an hour and ten minutes to ask about timing. Was put on hold for five minutes. Told it was just leaving then (at an hour and fifteen minutes) and it would be another 20 minutes. Asked to speak to the manager. Rude employee put me on hold for another five minutes. Manager says "we're very busy" - no apology, no offer to make it right.

After an hour and 35 minutes, I called the store, and the manager "was busy." Told them to cancel the order and tell the driver to not show up.

The driver showed up at an hour and 45 minutes. Told him to take the food back as I'd made other plans.

Unbelievable.
author: Dan C.

description:
got the margherita pizza because grubhub had a bunch of stars on it

pizza got delivered cold and was just plain not good. 

It was cold bread with crap on it
author: Pavan K.

description: Gotta say ... this pizza was the first time my pizza all around was crispy it was soo bomb! Even tho tiny greasy on top but i didnt car! Pizza was delic.
author: Jose V.

description: Delicious pizza and fast delivery. Competes with Domino's 30 minutes. Ordered the Meat Lovers and the Hawaiian pizzas. Very impressed for such a small pizza place.
author: Ian R.

description: We order this at work sometimes because it is the only place who will deliver to us. Pizza is bad. Too little sauce, cheap dough and poor quality. You eat it because you're hungry and you don't have options, but regret it immediately as it makes your stomach feel bloated and you got no enjoyment out of the flavorless meal. If you have other options, use them.
author: Jennifer W.

description: We have always ordered from Mr Pizza man and for the most part we have had great experiences but the last couple of months rhe delivery people have been rude and they dont come to my unit to deliver the pizza. Today the pizza was not thoroughly cooked and therr was grease EVERYWHERE. The cheese slipped right off and it tastes gross because of the excess oil. Its unfortunate because we order pizza from there at least 1x a week but not anymore!
author: G R.

description: Best service friendly people good pizza and they are also willing to be creative. They made me a pepperoni cheese stick pizza amazing! See pictures
author: Jose P.

description: Late night pizza joint. Pretty much what you'd expect. Time estimate for a fresh single slice took about twice as long as they said (10 vs 5 mins) but it was tasty and was probably the only reliable option between 2 and 3am.
author: Joel A.

description:
I really have no idea as to why I ate here.  Oh wait, because it is really close and it was open late.  Place seems like a hit or miss.  I actually went here twice thinking that the first time was just bad pizza.  Second time I went, I couldn't even finish my meal.

Even if I was paid to eat here, I wouldn't.

-5/5
author: Gary K.

description: Ordered a pizza and the lazy delivery guy wouldn't bring it to my apartment. It's one particular guy, and he does it every time. Thanks a lot! I canceled the order and won't be ordering any more. Get your act together guys! I'll just go with Amici's next time. I will say.. the food is actually good.. but this is a deal breaker.
author: Jeffrey O.

description: delivery paid 60 bucks no sauce on pizza...no extra sauce as requested....and for god sakes I dont want a veggie wedgie
author: Aquarius R.

description:
I've ordered pizza from this company for years when I lived in the Peninsula. It was hit and miss from great to mediocre. 

Since I've been ordering delivery from this location as well as eating slices at the Daly City store I have not had a bad experience or pizza. Deliveries have come fast and I am a big fan of crusty pizza.
author: Dale M.

description: This is probaly my favorite pizza place in sf its greasy but i enjoy it i would recomend it to anyone thats feeling pizza not pizza hut or dominos this is the best place
author: Jose A.

description:
Unfortunately just found a strip of cardboard inside the pasta.  With Italian pastas being so common at restaurants, we can't take the health risk of ordering food here again.  I have to assume it was malicious...most likely from a jerkoff cook.

Cooks pouring food into the foil container can easily tell if its clean and empty or not.  

May not be the fault of owner but the staff is untrustworthy now.
author: Gilbert C.

description:
I'll preface this by saying the food is actually pretty good especially the spaghetti and ravioli dinners with garlic bread.  But I won't be going back there for one simple reason and it's the customer service.  The two guys who are usually the cooks are really good and actually get orders correct.  But the kind of tall guy with the glasses is a mess to begin he doesn't know the menu when it's right in front of him.  He's rude and wears his headphones while trying to take orders when he can't even take an order paying attention.  

I placed an order for takeout he said it would be done in 10 minutes and he didn't even give the order to the cook and didn't even apologize he's just awful  Then he tried to charge me $16.00 for a meal that was only $7.00 and didn't apologize.  Because of this guy and his bad attitude I won't be going back.
author: The R.

description: Great late night food, awesome that they deliver later than most other pizza places, they usually deliver on time or even faster as well
author: Milton G.

description: I only eat pizza a couple of times a year. For the last 16-18 years I've tried others here in the Mission, having "bought in" to the hype. I ordered an Aloha pizza from them today. It was perfect. The crust was lightly brown, no dark areas. The cheese was perfectly gooey. They included crushed pepper and Parmesan  without request, but I'm so glad they did. This was my only place 18-23 years ago, and will be my only place now into the future.
author: Donald W.

description:
Yelp, sometimes I really do wish you'd let me give negative stars (sighs) because this place is so bad I feel misleading even giving them one star.
HMMMM where to start with this place...from the start lets go through the list
1)Ordering the pizza- female was extremely rude and wouldn't let me even finish my order before trying to hang up on me. Said it would be an 30 minutes , try an hour and a half
2) Pizza and garlic bread finally comes and the guy is just as rude as the female on the phone. Didn't carry crushed red peppers or parmesan packets (What pizza guy doesn't carry them!)
3) Finally open the box and the pizza was so flimsy  and crappy looking I was hesitant to serve it to my guest but after waiting forever I knew they were hungry. Big mistake! Not one person finished their slice it didn't even taste like pizza which was very scary. It didn't really taste like anything but salt. I had to order from Bravos and save the night with some beers.
author: Coley G.

description:
I WISH I COULD DO NO STARS!!
My pizza was 2 hours being delivered,  and it was si cold!!

When i called in the fuy says the manager is in tomorrow. ...i called back and all of a sudden he was the owner. His name was Gublert, he was rude and made a racial remark.

MR. PIZZAMAN WILL NEVER, EVER GET ONE THIN DUM
author: Felycia M.

description: The Mr pizza Man in San Francisco, is the best of the Bay Area,everything there is fresh and the guys that work there very nice and super polite.
author: Wanderson S.

description: I've been trying a lot of pizzas around San Francisco, and I have to say that Mr Pizza Man it's my favorite! I also tried the spaghetti and I have to admit, it's amazing, the meat sauce it's so tasteful. I recommend!!!!
author: Kleiton S.

description: Mr. pizza man been around for a while eating pizza since I was a kid. Same recipe same great taste one bite always reminds me of when I was a kid. The staff is always nice so come on by and see it then
author: Eddy J.

description:
What are you people expecting from a late night pizza joint ?  I am in Hunters Point and nobody here delivers, some pizza and Chinese places even close at 5 pm.
I always get the ex large pepperoni and it's great old school pizza, salty greasy and great
and those bitching about delivery, have you heard about tipping ? First delivery I tipped $5, ever since my pizza comes fast and hot.
author: Tom D.

description: Incapable of taking down a correct address , and insist on saying" we rang your door bell and called you 10 times"  , there was one call , I called the driver back ,he did not answer , I asked to cancel my order and got hung up on . And was charged for no delivery at all . Only bothered with the place (food actually sucks) cause they are 6 blocks away , this all after waiting 2 hours for non delivery . Rude , unprofessional , list goes on
author: jet b.

description: I love love love this place! Open late & really cheap, the staff is always really nice. Try the calzones & or just a regular slice of pizza !
author: Michelle R.

description: I truly enjoyed their buffalo wings! Made with great seasoning with a dash of love! Would totally come back here again.
author: Stacy M.

description: My husband is from St Louis,  the home of toasted raviolis.   This place has the most authentic and tasty raviolis west of the Mississippi.   For this alone, it's worth ordering from here.
author: mindy r.

description: Never again.! We been buying from here because they open late but tonight is the last time.. I'm not sure if they need to go back to school to read orders online or what.! I ordered half of pizza of ham and the other half of ham, jalapeno,onions, etc, no they decided to put it on the whole pizza (it happened before with previous orders). It had this nasty, funny look.. the cheese looked so chewy. *And the worst part, once I was picking the jalapenos out of my slice I found a small disgusting hair.! I didn't even eat anymore.. I also ordered a slice of tiramisu cake instead of being nice and smooth, it was so frozen from the inside , it was like I was eating an ice cream cake..  I wish I could go back and take a pic of the hair on the pizza to upload it but I threw it away because I was mad. Never a again. Zero stars.
author: Yancy M.

description: Been coming here since I was a kid.. they use to be really good but for some reason the pizza is doughy and has no flavor. Just ordered a extra large fiesta with no  ground beef but I did add pepperoni... so the pizza was pepperoni mushroom and onion. This was a good pie and the delivery was quick. They usually take 1 hour to delivery. I guess they werent busy. The wings suck here not recommended they taste like they were frozen and oven baked not fried. The calzones here are good you just have to tell rhem to cool it with the ricotta unless u like alot of it. If u order an extra large three topping pizza they give u a small cheese pizza for free thats a good perk. I give them  Three stars cause the hours they are open and  u can get a good pie at times. The prices are fair.
author: Rigoberto C.

description:
MR. PIZZA MAN IS THE BEST. They're open late, they're really great, and they satiate...my appetite!

Best things there: Pepperoni pizza, hot wings, and wedge cut fries!
author: Lara O.

description: They have taken nearly 2hrs to deliver a small pizza. I called and the guy was super rude! Said it was on way. That was over hour ago. Never again!
author: Storm J.

description: Sometimes you just need a slice. Is is the best pizza in town? No. But it'll do just fine. It's hot and if you order a slice they'll actually cook it in the oven for you fresh (ish) not jus reheat something that's been sitting on the countertop. That's the late night deal at least.
author: Roland O.

description: When my roommates and I moved into Potrero, we ordered pizza from all the nearby options - Mr. Pizza Man was hands down the best! I'm not giving 5 stars because of Delfina, Una Napoletana, etc. but if you just want cheesy goodness delivered to your door, Mr. Pizza Man is great! I recommend.
author: spiffy b.

description:
Bleugh. Wiping my tongue with hand. Yeah I know that's gross. But I had to something to get the taste of Mr. Pizza Man to go away.

This place is probably the only thing that's open late (actually 24hrs late) in the area. But even so, I would rather trek my butt to IGA (once Cala), than step inside this place again.

I came here awhile back, when I was craving some food late at night. 

My bf warned me about it, but I shrugged off his: "ok...well don't say I didn't tell you...."

with a "Come on, it's pizza? How do you mess that up?"

BUT Mr. Pizza Man managed to destroy everything that's wonderful and sacred about pizza.

They're overpriced.  They're slow. They're grumpy. I didn't even finish my slice of bleugh. It was burned, tasteless, and lukewarm. (ie: reheated)

and I had to hand over a BIG sheepish -

"Yeah, you were right." to my eye-brow raised bf.

Not only did you take my cab money Mr. P Man, but you had to take my pride too. 

Come on now!
author: Jessica T.

description:
I LOVE mr pizza man! Holy bajeesuz their pepperoni is the single best slice I've ever eaten. Maybe it's the way they bake a single slice at a time. It's something about that crust... or maybe the pepperoni.. it could even be the cheese... but good grief that pizza is GOOD. 

And the dudes working there are chill as popsicles! And they're always open, always smiling, always serving me amazing single slices of fresh baked delicious. Love it.
author: Wyatt R.

description:
The only thing that keeps this place running is the fact that it's the only 24hour pizza delivery in San Francisco.  When I have friends too drunk to drive home and they want to order Mr. Pizza man, I make them visualize a half baked pizza crust that's been vomited on.  That's what you end up with.  Ever try holding a piece in your hand? It's a joke... they may be laughing all the way to the bank...but I'm not havin it.  "Pizza on the west coast is no good" this is what they are referring to.  So nasty you've gotta use a spoon to eat it.  

Too bad there are no stars to rate this cause Mr. Pizza Man gets a negative three stars!
author: B H.

description: yo this place is bomb. been coming here since I was a little one ! been around since the 80s or 90s I believe. This place is dope and cheap.
author: Yeni K.

description:
No, no, no! Pizza should not be like this! I love pizza, and I'd would rather eat a pizza pocket that pizza from here.  I'm almost embarrassed to say that I've eaten here, but in my defense I was starving and it was convenient.  Something is off, maybe the sauce and crust.  On top of that, my stomach does not feel good afterwards...I try to stay downwind from everyone, if you catch my drift.  

Eat here if you want, but there a better places nearby!
author: Lesliegh H.

description:
So last night I was starving after I got off the late shift from work. Being super tired and hungry i wanted something quick and easy, so since dejavu was closed I settled on Mr. Pizza man. 

They said the delivery time was 45 minutes to an hour. A little over an hour later I call to see if it was on it's way ("your order was placed, theres a bit of a back up").  An *hour and a half* later I call back to make sure my pizza was actually coming, and the phone guy scoffs, 

"Your order was already placed JUST HANG ON A MINUTE" and hangs up. 

wait wait wait... aren't you supposed to apologize when things are late? Not get mad at the CUSTOMER? Needless to say, when the pizza actually arrived it was cold and soggy. Never ever ever ordering from here again, and I suggest you do the same.
author: Cake S.

description: Ordered a large mushroom and chicken pizza at like 3am. It didnt come super fast, but then again, it was a friday night and everyone probably had drunchies. The pizza was surprisingly gooood! It was super satisfying, lots of toppings, lots of cheese, and all around decent pizza for a small corner restaurant. It was $25 I believe.
author: Isabella L.

description: I live three blocks away and it takes them an hour and a half to deliver an undercooked pizza, at $25 a pizza, I'm surprised they're in business. Next time I'm going to round table.  Don't waste you money with this place, food is disgusting.
author: Jay E.

description: Love this place. I used to live around the corner and went there all the time for pizza. I was sad when I moved further away, but happy to find out that they deliver to my door!! On a busy day the pizza can take up to an hour to arrive, negative. Positive, the pizza is great! Specially if you add pesto to it. I usually get the family deal which comes with a large pizza, wings(YUM!), and a liter of soda. I think its totally worth it!!
author: Ashley S.

description: this place sucks shady dirty n never wear gloves not trust worthy clowns scum bags low life's don't trust the comments or mrpizzadude if your  sober not edible
author: Oso O.

description:
I have no idea how this place manages to stay in business.

No, wait.  Actually, I do.  It has no competition, especially late at night. The wings are just okay, but the pizza is really awful. When it's still open at night we order all way from Chico's in SOMA.

Once Little Star, or some other hipster pizza joint, stays open late and delivers, this place will go out of business. No tears will be shed. Most would argue that day can't come soon enough.
author: Adam Z.

description: I love this Pizza Place! They just don't make pizza like this anymore. They have the right amount of cheese and the crust is just the perfect consistency. This is one of my favorite pizza joints in San Francisco.
author: Vanessa C.

description:
It was like a scene from "Lady and the Tramp"... 

Before an evening of heavy out of town birthday evening drinking I demanded food in my tummy before gallons of of cheap booze. Strolled down to the closest pizza spot my google map pointed me to and expect to just grub a slice then call it a night, head to the bar. But the menu had a vast array from the norm pizza spot to Brazilian specials. 

So yea, the tramp I was with speaks Spanish fluently but the guys running this place weren't speaking Italian or Spanish they were speaking Portuguese. Took a couple minutes to figure this out after I ordered a large plate of spaghetti instead of slices of pizza. (But I rather enjoyed the mystery of it all and did not hold it against them for not being Italian.. I make great pasta and I surely am not Italian.) 

Watched some soccer on the flat screen and a few cozy tables, the place was rather cute. Our order of  spaghetti with meat sauce came up and it tasted so good. I really felt like I was in Italy eatting grandma's original recipe (even though I have never met grandma or her wonderful country). With fresh warm buttery bread and it was perfect for two. The guys there were friendly and I left completely satisfied.
author: Alison B.

description:
This stuff is shit.  I had it delivered to SF General Hospital while on overnight call.  It took nearly an hour (it's 3 blocks away) and arrived cold, soggy, greasy and incompletely-cooked.  Looked and tasted worse than something out of the freezer.  Multiple times since this particular incident, other unknowing staff here have had Mr. Pizza Man and the results have been similar.  
They do not deserve the title "Mr." or "Man" at all.  Nor "pizza" for that matter.  
Avoid.
author: Eric S.

description:
One word: Hair!
well three if you count them all individually,
now I'm not usually one to care about a one time hair-in-food trauma, but come-on now? Three hairs?! And on two seperate occasions? Its almost as bad as biting into one of those little hard chunks in food, totally kills your appetite. 
 I used to work at pizza hut and the cooks always made sure to wear hats, and if they forgot them, they'd have to wear the dreaded *hair net* eww.
Also, they have some pretty nasty mozerella sticks.

Now, you must be wondering why in the world they're getting three stars; well for one they've always been pretty polite. And they're deffinitely the best place to go to for a late night delivery, who else does it in half an hour, and does it right?

Being a fan of thick crust, I happen to think they do it very well. Plus they're variety of specialty pizzas is quite impressive. 
Is it the best pizza I've ever had; no
Will I order from them again; probably, but if I find one more hair, i'm probably have to stop.
But hey everyone deserves another chance.
author: Mercedez P.

description: No idea why everyone's so down on this joint. Best wings, best delivery, nice people. The pizza is 'eh', but I've never had to wait more than 30 minutes. Several other pizza joints have let me down more than once. Thanks Mr Pizza Man(s).
author: Greg H.

description:
There is one reason why I might ("might" being the operative word here) give Mr. Pizza Man a call, and one reason only.  Because it's open 24 hours a day.  That's the only reason, and even when I do so it's with a certain sigh of regret -- it literally feels as if I'm doing so under duress.

This pizza is so bad, it requires a thesaurus to safely finish writing this little hit piece I'm planning.  But, it's also so damn horrible, that it's not even worth putting that much effort into explaining to my fellow Yelpers as to how god awful this pizza is.  It's -- wow -- nearly unfathomable to me that this round disc of dough with sauce and cheese and toppings could be fucked up so singularly and thoroughly, and done with so much malice towards what a pizza should look and taste like.  My God -- when Mr. Pizza Man comes to my door, the happiness is sucked out of the house.  It's like that scene in The City of Lost Children when the evil Krank opens a door as his living brain compatriot is celebrating a birthday with a cake.  All the candles extinguish on cue.

I'm sure you're probably asking yourself, "Why does he call them at all, if he feels this way about their pizza?  Does he really need to put himself through all this unnecessary stress?"

Unfortunately, I do.  Once I have it in my head that only a pizza will do, then only a pizza will do.  Round Table delivers until 11.  Cable Car delivers until 3.  After 3, you're kind of fucked.  Mr. Pizza Man is the pizza of last resort.  And they're open 24 hours.  So that's why.

"Pizza is like sex," they like to say.  "When it's good, it's really, really good.  When it's bad, it's still kind of good."  Whoever "they" are, they've never tasted this crap.  My God, it's dreadful.  It's most unpleasant.  It's reprehensible.  It's inferior.  It's objectionable.  It's nearly injurious.  It's distressing.

But it's still pizza.  Even though it will arrive long after the due time cold and soggy and squishy and sloped off to one side of the box due to being held at an angle without even having been placed in one of those heat-bags, I will still bite my tongue, stick it in the oven and then eat it with a fork due to its unstableness.

God, I hate this place.
author: Thomas B.

description:
Wow... methinks not indeed. I mean, pizza is impossible to mess up right? Wrong. 

Mr. Pizza Man has managed to make the worst pizza I've ever had. And because it's open SO late and is so close to my apartment, I've experienced the displeasure of its poorly-made pies several times. The crust is all chewy and uncooked, the cheese has this weird plasticky texture, and the toppings are just tossed right on top. Its only saving grace (i suppose) is that it delivers really really really late. But like, even the 4am drunchies don't really make me willing to eat it. 

Today I saw a small dead mouse outside. I am not implying that Mr. Pizza Man has mice, or that it's dirty. Rather, I assume that the mouse had a bite of their pizza and most likely fainted out of pure shock squealing, "how could anyone screw up PIZZA this bad!?" on its way down.

Sorry Mr. Pizza Man, I hate to slam you, but I would love it if you just went away and were replaced with something more delicious.
author: Stephanie P.

description:
I used to think there was one massive Mr. Pizza Man somewhere in the Bay Area that delivered to the entire region twenty-four hours a day.  I now realize what a naive belief that was, but sometimes--especially with food--we like to delude ourselves in so many ways.

Anyway, this is the Mr. Pizza Man location whose services I've used the most often.  I work overnights nearby, so we often have them deliver pizza or pasta when all the good places are closed.  Mr. Pizza Man delivers twenty-four hours a day in San Francisco, so it's definitely an option when you're starving and everything is closed.

The pizza itself used to be really bad.  Then it was really good for a while.  And now it's kind of mediocre.  I'm used to pizzas being slightly different from the same place, but I've never experienced the swings anywhere else that I've experienced here.  They have some pretty good deals online, so make sure you check out their online coupons section.

The pasta is greasy and delicious.  Only order it if you like cheese.  And I mean really like cheese.  Delivery can take a while, especially after three a.m. (I assume because all the other pizza places have closed and this place is swamped), but it's usually decent and is sometimes lightning quick.
author: John S.

description:
Yay! I'm a fan. I want to start out by saying I only get slices here. I think the delivery option here is crap since it can take upwards of hours to get your pie and it is not cheap.

But as pizza slices go, these are pretty amazing. The greasy factor does exist but if we could move beyond this by patting your slice and taste the full flavored cheese. I think it is a rare form of Brazilian MSG they sprinkle on the cheese that keeps me wanting more. Or maybe the doughy goodness of the crust? 

These pizza slices are great with pineapple and jalapeno... sweet and salty with just a bit too much of cheese grease. :)

*oh a ps. they are a franchise so each mr. pizza man is locally owned (and they are slightly different in terms of quality)
author: Shannon Z.

description: Mr. Pizza man has a vast menu with a very tasty variety. They include popular Brazilian cuisines, hot sandwiches, salads, appetizers and a great pizza menu. The cheese and sauce they use has a very succulent and great taste to it that is second to none. It's pizza makers are flexible and can make virtually any style of pizza to your liking. My wife wanted spinach pesto, thin crust, light cheese and light sauce and they made it exactly to her liking. They deliver, do pick up and if you'd like to eat it there, you can too.
author: Bernie P.

description: Great food, I love the pizza and I pick up food for my sister from them a few days a week. A couple days I was broke and picking up my sisters dinner. I was thinking about asking if they needed someone to fill the cooler and sweep up in exchange for a pizza. I couldn't ask lol, but i will be back when I get paid this week. They have a big menu that has many other options for people who may not like pizza. Burgers and pasta, calzones, cake and more.
author: Sean G.

description:
Absolutely HORRIBLE!! When we called at 3:30 AM to order a pizza, the woman taking calls was EXTREMELY RUDE, hung up on me on the first call and then told me they were closed when I called back... Closed? How is this possible, when right on their website it says they deliver 24 hours?! When we tried to call a third time, it went straight to their "on hold" recording and no one ever answered. W T F!! I will NEVER attempt to order a single thing from this place again, and I encourage everyone else to take my advice when I say they are totally undeserving of your business.

Now would somebody please open a decent 24 hour delivery joint in SF?
author: P A U L.

description:
2 words: Fried Ravioli.
Dipped in ranch dressing-it's nothing short of a mouth orgasm.

The pizza is OK...if you're dying.
author: Shelley S.

description:
The pizza is greasy, yes.  It isn't the best slice of pizza you will ever have, agreed.  But on my way to work it's simple to stop here for a slice of pepperoni and the two times I've had pepperoni were divine.  I stopped by on my way home from work Tuesday night and decided to get a slice of pepperoni and sausage (inspired by seeing someone's Paxti's Pizza) and I was unpleasantly surprised.  The sauce seemed a little too sweet for my liking.  Will I continue to stop by occasionally for a quick slice? Yeah, probably.

I'm determined to try some of their Brazilian cuisine, though.  But for some strange reason they don't make any past 6 (which is pure BS imo)

My biggest gripe with this place isn't even the food, it's the service.  It feels like every time I've walked in to this place I am ignored for at least 3-4 minutes.  No "hello", no "how are you today", not even a "can I help you"...  and I end up standing in front of the cash register with one, sometimes 2 guys behind the register appearing to be busy but a simple "just one sec" would do... I mean I'm standing here looking like an idiot- I'm ready to order!
author: J.Michelle P.

description:
When we first moved to the area my lady and I really liked this place.  They were convenient and still delivered after all the other places that served real food closed down.  Of course, when it's late and you're drunk, almost anything warm on a plate taste good...  

Fast forward two years later and I really can't stand this place anymore.  The pizza is not greasy as much as the middle of the pizza is soggy and limp.  My staple for a pizza is sausage, mushroom, and cheese and Mr. Pizza Man consistently delivers a soggy pie.  I was told by a friend that maybe it's because the oven doesn't get warm enough on the bottom and the cheese melts before the dough on the bottom is cooked.  Whatever the reason, I'll probably go to Little Star, Pizza Orgasmica, or Goat Hill for my pizza fix next time.
author: Neil W.

description: This place blows. The pizza is mediocre, though cheap. They're always so cranky on the phone too. The last time I called the woman asked me if I wanted anything else, so I turned to my friends to confirm that's all they wanted. She got impatient and started yelling. I told her to just cancel my order. I don't do bitches.
author: Raquel R.

description: WORST DELIVERY EVER! I have never been so upset at a delivery service. They were extremely late, and the food didn't even make up for the fact that they were late. Since when does a bacon burger mean a piece of rubbery meat in between a piece of sandwich bread? HORRIBLE! And the guy even ignored my instructions to knock on the downstairs flood instead of the upstairs floor so he probably woke up my upstairs neighbors.
author: Laura B.

description: $2.79 for a cheese slice.  It was thin and not a lot of sauce which is my preference but the sauce itself tasted "canny" and the crust was below par.
author: Jeff J.

description:
Mr. Pizza Man isn't good. Period.

But if you need some pizza at 3o'clock in the morning and you're wasted out of your mind, it most definitely hits the spot.

Any other time, I'd recommend a myriad of places that offer delicious pizza, namely Pizza Orgasmica. But hey, beggars can't be choosy.
author: Rodney P.

description:
Just gave me food poisoning for three days.
Chucking my guts up.
I never get food poisoning so the food hygiene must be pretty piss poor.
author: Jake S.

description: It took a really long time to arrive, it tasted better once doused with copious hot sauce, the wings were pretty good.  For very drunk 3am pizza it's fine but only as a last resort.
author: Emily T.

description: Very good pizza and they deliver to Treasure Island which is awesome! Thanks Mr. Pizza Man.
author: William P.

description:
why does everyone say that this is 24 hour delivery pizza!!!
this is just a lie.  they do not deliver between 4 and 9:30 am, which is when i wanted pizza this weekend.  but whatever, it is still nice to be able to order pizza past midnight.
i think the pizza it relatively decent.  i like the cheese and the hawaiian special.  it is not cheap, but delivery often isn't.  
100xs better that dominos 3 pizzas for $15, i will say that!
author: charlene l.

description:
Mr. Pizza Man? Isn't that like, a franchise or someting?

I guess it is, but for those in my neighborhood (Potrero/Dogpatch), we've tried Bowser's, Cybelle's, and a host of others after finally settling on Mr. Pizza Man.

It's by far the best that delivers to our area.

 It's no Orgasmica, it's not Goat Hill. It's not Pauline's. But it's fast, efficient and open super late. And they deliver. And they don't discriminate against very very drunk people.
author: Asdf A.

description: Good pizza joint. I'd definitely go back. Late night service is a plus.
author: David R.

description:
There has been many a night since I've moved to SF that I've had a fever, a fever for pizza.  I'm from Chicago, yeah?  The land of the real american-ized pizza, made right, and more often than not, a well-made pie was a drunken necessity for me and my gang.

I was originally weary of eating pizza from a state that has a franchise of shacks named after it that take flat bread, throw some fucking avocado and nineteen other ingredients on it, and call it pizza.  My friends said, "No, no, no. Seriously, there's a couple of good joints in this town," and I'll admit it, I've have had some decent slices from other places, but those places close at reasonable hours and I'm typically not belligerent and desperately hungry during business hours.  So, I have to go for what grubhub.com tells me is open and that's Mr. Pizza Man.  

Mr. Pizza Man is a man who works til 3am and I appreciate that, but last night was the last fucking straw.  This place sucks the casbah and I'm going to tell you (in detail) why:

First off, there's the business of placing an order.  Whoever they've got working the phones really needs to take a class on self-esteem because i can never hear a word he's fucking saying.  I'm not trying to be a bitch here, but seriously, come on.  Yeah, I'm probably going to need you to repeat yourself several times and I will do the same because well, you know, I'm drunk and all..  it's just a huge pain in the ass when I have to go "HELLO? HELLO?" nine times like an asshole because old boy is so soft-spoken that I only know he answered the phone because of the background noise.

Then there's the problem of the order itself: what they advertise on their specialty pizzas is typically not what you get.  Actually, no matter what you order is typically not what you get. For reals: because this place is one of the few joints that's open late, I've suffered through several of these Bitch Pies and every time I order something, it either shows up missing something important (hello - cheese?! sauce?!) or totally insane (please continue to read).  Like last night, we got the Veggie Deluxe: MOTHER FUCKING BULLSHIT, man.  

When our pizza didn't arrive in the thirty minutes they told us it would take to get there, we called and they said it would be there "any minute" because there was only one order that needed to be delivered before ours.  We then had to call AGAIN when it still hadn't arrived after an hour.  Yes, we actually FELL ASLEEP waiting for the pizza and let me tell you, we don't ever crash before the pizza arrives because we're typically jazzed out of our minds that it's coming.  When fella arrived, I met him at the front door and was like "Hey, how's it going? Where've you been cruising tonight?" (you know, small talk) and he gets ALL FREAKED OUT and defensive and says, "Oh, sorry about the time! You know.. I had other deliveries and stuff.."  I was just like, "Yeah, yeah, yeah," and didn't tip because he made the mistake of handing me the pizza box to sign on and the bottom of the fucker was soggy (aka, the pizza had been sitting in this guy's back seat for awhile.)

Now, here's where I want to really freak out: I want to know who's genius idea it was to throw RAW garlic on a pizza.  Seriously.  WHAT THE FUCK?!  I mean, yeah it was late at night but do you really think that because I'm pissed at 3.30 in the morning, I'm going to just chow down on any fucking thing you decide to throw on my pizza and not call the boss in the morning?!  Au contraire, asshole.

Sadly, old boy on the phone said boss-man isn't going to be in until tomorrow so I have to wait until tomorrow to let Mr. Pizza Man know he can go fuck himself and/or I want a refund/free pizza made with a lot of really expensive shit on it - I'm talking lobster, caviar, gold leaf and sauce made a with Dom Perignon reduction.  Oh yeah, I think I deserve a pair of gold teeth and pimp cup studded in diamonds, rubies and sapphires too because that pizza was beyond crap.

I will not be eating Mr. Pizza Man ever again.  Fuck you, dude.
author: kates d.

description:
Good: Good Pizza and good friendly attitude.

Bad: The place is kind of dirty and the menu is a little confusing.


Overall good and would come back again.
author: Jerry Y.

description: I found this place by accident. I was walking home from the gym one day and I was wondering what am I having for lunch. There used to be one much closer to my house then they changed businesses. Their lunch specials are well worth it. I get the slice with a soda combo. One of the best pizzas I've tasted in the city and for the area. I've been there about 3 times now and never had a 'greasy' slice. It was a good size for the money. Toppings are plentiful and fresh. Great place for lunch, sunny and quiet.
author: E W.

description:
clearly, our experience at "mr. pizza man" was not unique. we ended up here after a party across the street and needed any kind of food to soak up the swill in our bellies or perish in the lonely streets of potrero.

first of all, yes, the pizza is disgusting. it was as though rolling out the dough was too demanding for them. seriously, it was a wadded up under a micro-thin layer of tomato sauce.

it's obvious that this joint has zero interest in making money, because who wouldn't have pre-prepped or made pizzas for late night rushes on the weekend? wtf??

the attitude of the staff is awful--more proof of this being a possible front for god knows what trafficking.

I'd rather eat an open bag of doritos from the street for nourishment.
author: G Z.

description: Sometimes I want a delicious meatball sandwich and a tasty brazillian soda.  Sometimes I can actually take an hour break for lunch from the hospital and walk to Mr. Pizza Man.  I'll tell you what--- its a good thing I can't go there everyday.   I'd be supersized for real... But seriously these guys are great they even let me use their phone to call the floor to see if anyone else wants a sammie.
author: Ona E.

description: 24 hour delivery and large assortment of appetizers.  But you're getting what you pay for, which is cheap, unsatisfying pizza.
author: Nick B.

description: Placed an order using their online ordering for my office - at 10:58am. Phoned at noon, as pizza hadn't arrived, was told the order 'arrived' at 11:24, and I'd need to wait 45 minutes to an hour. I called again at 12:24, said order had 'arrived' at 11:37, and I'd have to wait 45 minutes to an hour. Called AGAIN at 12:40, as pizza STILL hadn't arrived, was told it was "minutes" away and to call back to arrange a discount - 12:50, pizza in hand (cold!), discount was $10 off, I made a stink, got a SLIGHTLY better discount - either way,  their customer service supervisor (Brittany) is a waste of oxygen, and their pizza isn't good anyhow- figured it'd be 'easy' for a big office order. NEVER AGAIN!
author: teriaki b.

description: Nothing was open late at night for food in SoMA except for, yes, Mr. Pizza Man.  We ordered a large pizza and buffalo wings for delivery.  The pizza was soggy and the crust was tasteless.  The buffalo wings on the other hand were quite good and hearty.  The meal was pricey ($37).  They delivered on time.  It achieved its purpose, which was to coat our stomachs with grease to counter the affect of our late night romp though the Mission.  Order only if desperate.
author: C C.

description: I remember the Mr. Pizza Man commericals... open 24 hours!!! I agree... if you're dying... get it... but after all these years...what ponders in my mind is... this pizza taste BETTER COLD.... :P
author: Peta C.

description:
BOYCOTT this restaurant.  Not only is the pizza disgusting, but so is the owner Olavo.

His delivery boy swiped our car.  Turns out he doesn't have a driver's license and no one in the place will claim ownership to the car.  The insurance card has a name that matches no one in the restaurant.

Olavo cussed me out when I confronted him for not cooperating with my insurance inspector.  

This place should be shut down!  Don't support these SCAM artists!
author: Joan W.

description: me and roommate ordered here once.  greasy but tasted ok.  it was the aftermath that killed us.  it tore up our stomachs and we cursed havin one bathroom.
author: Lito S.

description: placed an order online, called an hour later, never received my order and was told it will be another hour before it comes. my lunch was over by then. spoke to a female and asked for a manager and she said no one was around...so were you answering the phones and baking them pizzas all by yourself? wow.....very, very poor service. go somewhere else if you don't want your lunch/dinner/midnight snack spoiled! read all the other reviews as well...
author: Michelle V.

description: fuck them....  they dont deliver to me now .   probably cause last time i called them, they were fucking late ... . 2 and half fucking hours ... if it was you , you would ask the driver to call and complain right? all i got was a 5 fucking dollar discount .  and i gave it to the fucking driver..  5 dollar tips to him. fuck them assholes.
author: sor j.
